result.execSummary:
The defendant Eloy Esparza Salas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eloy Esparza Salas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eloy Esparza Salas was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Supervision by the Mental Health Unit.

miscConds.notes:
Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to monies owed.
If revoked, DOC to collect sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide a specimen for DNA testing if not already done so.
Mental health evaluation. Comply with any recommended treatment.

No drugs without a valid prescription.
No Contact Order with Isabelle G. and/or her family.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any recommended treatment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund
3/24/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Eloy Esparza Salas in court with Attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeds.  Parties review the PSI report.  For reasons stated on the record, Court will not consider the PSI as defendant is unable to state what information is or is not correct contained in the PSI report.
State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -   36 months, consecutive to any other sentence; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  18 months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  18 months.  
COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  3  years.

Court finds defendant   IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and  IS  eligible for the Substance abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
-  Defendant to be supervised by the Mental Health unit
-  Mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Take all prescribed medication
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  No Contact Order with Isabelle G.    AND/OR  her family
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to monies owed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
-  Defendant to be supervised by the Mental Health unit
-  Mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Take all prescribed medication
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  No Contact Order with Isabelle G.    AND/OR  her family
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to monies owed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a specimen for DNA testing (if not already done so).
-  If confinement served - DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Eloy Esparza Salas in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.   No appearance from State of Wisconsin.  Due to time constraints and state unable to appear, matter adjourned for sentencing.

Parties informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders, Room 629 of the Courthouse.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Eloy Esparza Salas in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Copy of PSI emailed to Attorney Louis Epps and ADA Michael Lonski on November 12, 2015.
Report by Dr. Suzanne J. Lisowski received and filed with court.

Defendant Eloy Esparza Salas in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED.    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY on COUNT 1.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on COUNT 1 as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   State requests a Presentence Investigation Report without sentencing recommendations.

Defendant Eloy Esparza Salas in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to time constraints, matter adjourned for projected guilty plea on September 24, 2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Eloy Esparza Salas in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another final pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Eloy Esparza Salas in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Justice Point Report addressed regarding medicaitons.   Defendant appeared later same day with a positive drug test from Justice Point.  Warrant issued and served on defendant.  Defendant taken into custody.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Eloy Esparza Salas in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps via telephone.  Jeremy Arn for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Epps involved in a jury trial in another court.  Status conference scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Additional Jury Instructions from Attorney Voss received and filed.
Defendant Eloy Esparza Salas in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another final pretrial date.
Original Transcript (13 pages) commencing 06/09/2015 PRELIMINARY HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Eloy Esparza Salas in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Ronald Dague for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Continued Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Elisabeth Wallich-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eloy Esparza Salas in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #14CF5409 that are attached to the complaint.  State is requesting an adjournment, detective is not available for today's proceedings.   Defense motion to dismiss will be taken under advisement by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for a Continued Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-03-2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Isabelle G. or her residence or place of employment

Defendant Eloy Esparza Salas in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/20/15 @ 1:30pm

Defendant Eloy Esparza Salas in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's other pending matter was rescheduled for another final pretrial.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
